definition: head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc
to pass/to spend (time)/measure/limit/extent/degree of intensity/degree (angles, temperature etc)/kilowatt-hour/classifier for events and occurrences

sentences.english: We were very disappointed with the results from the new car"s first trial run."
sentences.chinese: 这辆车在首度试开之后，让我们非常失望。

sentences.english: The prime minister is preparing to address parliament on the crisis for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 巴国总理已经打算首度发表议会演讲，化解危机。

sentences.english: This is the "Saudi Eagle" first visit to Europe.
sentences.chinese: 此次是“沙特之鹰”首度访问欧洲。

sentences.english: For the first time in 12 years, liposuction is a runner-up in popularity to breast augmentation.
sentences.chinese: 隆胸术的流行程度12年来首度超过吸脂术。

sentences.english: For the first time in IQ testing, psychologists have found that female scores have risen above those of men.
sentences.chinese: 心理学家发现，女性智商测验的分数首度超过了男性。

sentences.english: In his debut earnings call with investors, Page made nary a mention of social.
sentences.chinese: 佩奇与投资者的首度收入会议对社交网络只字未提。

sentences.english: Several of these rhododendrons will flower this year for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 这些杜鹃花有些将在今年首度开花。

sentences.english: The Broadway musical My Fair Lady has opened for its first night in London, to a rapturous reception.
sentences.chinese: 百老会音乐剧我的美丽天使首度伦敦公演。

sentences.english: Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing saw its profits grow 53 per cent and break through the $1 billion mark for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 港交所纯利上升53%，首度突破十亿大关。

sentences.english: This is the largest mocap volume in the world and first time it's been done outside.
sentences.chinese: 这是世界上最大动作捕捉摄影棚，也是首度户外拍摄。

sentences.english: It was the first bird flu epidemic to hit Japan in 79 years, officials said.
sentences.chinese: 官员们宣称，这是日本地区时隔七十九年后，首度发。

sentences.english: The airline company launched a European route for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 这个航空公司首度放飞欧洲航线。

definition: to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards

to strike a pose (Chinese opera)/(fig.) to make a public appearance/to come out in public (revealing one's true personality, opinions etc)/(of a product) to appear on the market or at a trade show etc
to be separated (from a friend, one's homeland etc) for a period of time/after a hiatus of (x years)
to carry/to take along/to bring along/to hold (hands)/also pr. [xi1]
